newsitem.title: USA: Mid Ocean sees continuing flight to quality.
newsitem.headline: Mid Ocean sees continuing flight to quality.

text.p: Mid Ocean Ltd chief executive Michael Butt said he believes the recent consolidation within the reinsurance industry reflects a "flight to quality" by customers seeking the safest firms to reinsure them.
Butt, commenting on the company's third quarter earnings in a statement, said operating results for the quarter were good and in line with expectations.

"The markets are increasingly competitive. However, the major consolidations taking place within the industry confirm our view that the flight to quality continues," he said. "We believe this trend offers opportunities for Mid Ocean."

Butt said Mid Ocean's third quarter benefited from a lack of significant catastrophe losses in the quarter. But, he said, the company experienced a negative comparison to the prior year's quarter in terms of realized investment gains and losses.

"We continue to make progress in diversifying our book of business," he said. And, given its investment in Brockbank Group "we are very pleased to see the Lloyd's reconstruction and renewal offer become unconditional."
Mid Ocean is a majority shareholder in the Brockbank Group and provides corporate capital to Lloyd's syndicates managed by Brockbank's managing agency.
Mid Ocean reported third quarter operating earnings of $1.49 a share compared to $1.35 a year ago.
